alert.note: Alert for Lanier; Lowndes; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 4:47AM EST until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Georgia, including the following counties, Brooks, Lanier, Lowndes and Thomas. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 446 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Quitman, Valdosta, Lake Park, Thomasville, Lakeland, Hahira, Boston, Ochlocknee, Pavo, Coolidge, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Meigs, Dasher, Morven, Barwick, Brooks Co A/p, Blue Springs and Barney. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
